question.text: In Eli Lily's method of insulin production, which of the following is correct?

options.text: A peptide and B peptide were produced from the same host cell
A peptide and B peptide were produced from different host cells.
A peptide, B peptide and C peptide were produced from the same host cell.
A peptide, B peptide and C peptide were produced from different host cells.

solution.text: Insulin is a protein hormone produced by the Islets of Langerhans which help in regulating blood glucose level in our body. Mature insulin has two peptide chains - chain A and chain B joined by disulfide bonds. The mature insulin is primarily produced as inactive pro-insulin having a chain C between chain A and B. Chain C is removed for activation of the hormone. Genetic engineering process faced the challenge in developing mature insulin and it was overcome by isolating the gene for chain A and chain B and then producing it in the host bacterial cell. Eli Lily, a pharmaceutical company, prepared two separate DNA sequences each making one protein - chain A and chain B which was then produced individually in different host cell. The extracted chains were later combined by creating disulfide bonds giving the mature human insulin.
